entry.title: Brewery Marketing Activities
entry.content:
Brewery Marketing Activities

Customer

One of the largest American-owned breweries.

Objective and solution

The application had to be utilized to place orders for promotional items. Orders may be placed by authorized associates via friendly web-based user interface. The application implies the back-end which is utilized by the application administrators to manage orders, users and other specific information.

Solution:

  • Application was built on top of ASP.NET
  • Integrated with online purchase service to make it possible to process payment in various ways
  • Employed Microsoft Reporting Services to generate sales reports

Project highlights

  • Development boosted by 3rd party components library
  • Successfully ported rich UI experience onto tablet devices
  • Customer saved resources that were spent on marketing activities

entry.title: Airlines Luggage Tags
entry.content:
Airlines Luggage Tags

Customer

A large airline based in California, with operations throughout the western United States and western Canada, as well as into Mexico.

Objective and solution

Company wanted to create online service that will allow customers to create custom luggage tags. Along with this service customer required:

  • Order management backend software
  • Integration with several printing companies

Solution:

  • ASP.NET powered site
  • Extensive use of JavaScript
  • Printing assets preprocessing and generation done with scheduler controlled Windows Services

Project highlights

  • Using the homegrown rapid prototyping framework first working prototype was launched in 1 week
  • Cross-browser WYSIWYG editor written fully in JavaScript
  • Service is W3C standards compliant
